title: Operational Excellence in Engineering | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This micro-credential equips learners with essential skills in Process Management, Lean Six Sigma, Total Quality Management, and Supply Chain Management to boost operational efficiency.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This micro-credential equips learners with essential skills in Process Management, Lean Six Sigma, Total Quality Management, and Supply Chain Management to boost operational efficiency.
Electronics Engineering, Systems Engineering, Process Engineering, Lean and Six Sigma, Business Management, Competency-based Education

Organisations thrive by optimising processes to deliver value and meet customer expectations. Underperformance often stems from process deficiencies and poor interaction with people and technology, highlighting the need for effective process management.

Effective process management is critical for operational excellence and overcoming performance deficiencies. This micro-credential provides the foundational knowledge, and skills needed to optimise organisational processes and drive performance improvements. It covers key areas including Process Management, Total Quality Management, Lean Six Sigma, and Supply and Inventory Management. Through a focus on these core competencies, the micro-credential aims to transform how organisations manage their processes and deliver value.

By mastering these competencies, learners will gain practical knowledge to improve process performance and drive organisational success. The micro-credential provides a comprehensive approach to understanding the tools and techniques necessary for operational excellence in various industries.
This micro-credential is part of the CSM Pathways in

Plant or factory manager, production engineer, manufacturing engineer, quality engineer and other professionals working in the planning and execution of processes leading to the production of goods and services.
Learners should possess analytical skills for problem-solving and decision-making, as well as basic statistical knowledge
Basic communication and writing skills are required to create content and complete written exercises

This micro-credential is predominantly delivered through a competency-based education (CBE) approach where learners acquire and demonstrate mastery of knowledge and skills that are directly relevant to job functions. This prepares them to be industry-ready where they can apply their newly acquired competencies to their work.
The above are competency units that constitute this micro-credential. Upon completion of the micro-credential, you will be able to:
Integrate quality management principles into an organisation’s systems
Manage continuous improvement projects to optimise an organisation's systems and processes
Manage inventory risk to satisfy demand at the lowest possible inventory costs

During the course, you will have access to a team of qualified success coaches who can work with you on learning strategies or to develop a personalised learning plan. Through the success coaches, you can gain access to a wide range of resources and support services, and be empowered with the necessary tools to navigate your learning journey successfully.
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Chun Yee specialises in mechatronics and microfluidics. He teaches relevant modules, including Industrial Automation, Robotics, Fluid Mechanics & Six Sigma in SIT-NU Mechanical Design & Manufacturing Engineering (MDME) Joint Degree Programme. He was previously a Research Fellow at the Nanyang Technological University, where he is the one of the co-inventors of a magnetic nanochain-integrated microfluidic biochip for early detection of cancer biomarkers. He holds a Bachelors in Engineering (Mechanical & Production Engineering with Mechatronics Specialization) and Doctor of Philosophy from the Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Asst Provost (Continuous Learning) /A/Prof /Deputy Dir, ARO, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Mustafa is an Associate Professor in the Engineering Cluster with Singapore Institute of Technology who specializes in Robotics and Lean Manufacturing. He is also the Deputy Director of SIT’s Applied Research Office, which provides overall strategic research direction as well as overseeing research governance and grant administration. He was previously a Research Scientist at the Singapore Institute of Manufacturing Technology A*STAR, leading a team in industrial robotics initiatives for productivity enhancement in the local manufacturing sector. 

In addition to actively teaching and developing robotics curriculum for both undergraduate and adult learners, he provides consultancy services and actively leads applied research projects to develop robotic automation solutions in various industry sectors such as manufacturing and built environment. He holds a Bachelors in Engineering (Mechanical & Production Engineering with Mechatronics Specialization) and Doctor of Philosophy (Robotics) from the Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Yee is an Associate Professor of Engineering at SIT and was its Vice President (External Relations). He was Vice President of ST Engineering prior to joining SIT. He is conversant with the planning and implementation of manufacturing processes and technologies at the shopfloor, facility and enterprise levels. He conducts the Official SIRI Assessment for companies.
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Professional Officer, Singapore Institute of Technology

Joshua Chan started his career in the semiconductor industry in the areas of industrial engineering. His achievement was the setup of Singapore’s first CCD manufacturing line and clean room capability for CCD manufacturing. His training and expertise is in integrating various business process reengineering solutions and using statistical tool for process improvement in the manufacturing sector. He received both Lean and Six Sigma training which he holds a Black Belt in Six Sigma initiatives. He has also worked in other industries varying from healthcare, plastic and applied chemical industry. His experience include designing, drafting and process optimization of plastic pneumatic conveying systems. He also involved in various auditing exercises and is certified to perform audits for ISO 9001, ISO/TS19649 and ISO14001/OHSAS 18001. His working experience is diversified; working in American, British, German, Japanese and French MNCs and local SMEs as well. He joined SIT in SIT as a Senior Professional Officer and is tasked in the lab practical instruction of various thermodynamics and unit operations experiments supporting SIT Pharmaceutical Engineering program and TUM Chemical Engineering program. Besides conducting lab classes, he is involved in various student learning initiatives as well as mentoring students for industrial projects in different areas of chemical and mechanical engineering.
Associate Professor /Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor /Prog Leader, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Lin is the Programme Leader of BSc in Digital Supply Chain at the Singapore Institute of Technology. He obtained his PhD in Engineering and MBA from Nanyang Technological University of Singapore in 2000 and 2003 respectively. Dr Lin is also a Certified Six Sigma Black Belt by American Society of Quality since 2007. Dr Lin teaches relevant modules, including supply chain management, demand and inventory planning, warehouse and transportation systems, systems modelling and simulation, and systems and project management in both the SIT Digital Supply Chain (DSC) programme and SIT-DigiPen Mechatronics Systems (METS) Joint Degree Programme. His research interests are in the areas of digital supply chain management, cyber-physical digital supply chain twin, machine learning, simulation and optimizsation for digital supply chains.
A Specialist Certificate in Operational Excellence in Engineering will be issued to learners who:
Attend at least 75% of the course and
Undertake and pass all credit bearing assessments
The learner will undertake a combination of written assessments (short answers, technical reports), projects, assignments and presentations.
The full fee for this course is S$10,006.20.
will be collected before course commencement.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.

Should you decide to convert to the degree pathway, you will be subject to SIT’s tuition fees and may qualify for the Ministry of Education (MOE) tuition grant, based on eligibility criteria set by MOE. Please note that the SkillsFuture subsidy will no longer be applicable once you convert to the degree pathway.
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.
Earn specialist certificates through micro-credentials in the following CSM pathways. Stack these micro-credentials towards a bachelor's degree at SIT.

Earn Specialist Certificates to broaden your career prospects in Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Stack them towards a degree in (IS) Engineering with our unique Competency-based Stackable Micro-credential (CSM) Pathway designed for working professionals.
BEng (Hons) in Infrastructure and Systems Engineering (via the CSM Pathway)
Mechanical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Robotics and Automation, Transport Engineering, Advanced Manufacturing, Competency-based Education

Earn Specialist Certificates to broaden your career prospects in Electrical and Electronic Engineering. Stack them towards a degree in (EE) Engineering with our unique Competency-based Stackable Micro-credential (CSM) Pathway designed for working professionals.
BEng (Hons) in Electrical and Electronic Engineering (via the CSM Pathway)
Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Power and Clean Energy, Sustainability, Data Science and Analytics, Robotics and Automation, Advanced Manufacturing, Competency-based Education
From Wilderness to Workplace: Finding Purpose and Power Through Lifelong Learning

“These programmes…are more than technical certifications – they're fundamental operating systems for professional effectiveness.” 
-- Eltian Chen, Graduate of (SCTP) Programme for the Lean Six Sigma Champion and Operational Excellence Manager
Lean and Six Sigma, Career Growth and Transition
More alumni return to S’pore universities to study, but more support needed
More people are returning to their alma mater for further studies over the past few years, with government support and more alumni engagement.
Career Growth and Transition, Competency-based Education
Improving Patient Outcomes through Advanced Clinical Supervision Competency

The Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) taps on evidence-based education practices to address the increasing demand for advanced clinical supervision competencies among Allied Health Professionals and improve patient outcomes.
Health Sciences, Adult and Geriatric Rehabilitation, Competency-based Education
Upskilling is Not an Uphill Task

Questions like “Am I too old?”, “Will I be able to keep up?” and “Can I afford it?” are often on the minds of adult learners when considering upskilling and upgrading. Robin Ngan, Director of the SITLEARN, tackles these questions and shares tips for how to make the most of one’s lifelong learning journey.
Competency-based Education, Career Growth and Transition
Helping SMEs Embed Sustainability in Business

Co-developed with the Association of Small & Medium Enterprises (ASME), the ‘Introduction to Sustainability for Businesses’ course provides companies with the knowledge and frameworks for mapping their sustainability goals.
What’s needed for stackable microcredentials toward a degree?
Forest Tan describes how to begin creating a flexible pathway where learners can accumulate microcredentials aligned to industry that can stack toward a degree.
Agile Orientation for Digital Transformation: Concepts, Practices and Mindsets
Master Agile methodology in this 2-day course. Gain theory, practical skills, and toolkits for real-world implementation and success
Green Transformation with Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) and B Corp Certification Process
Master sustainable business practices to boost operational performance, focusing on SEA and B Corp certifications for long-term growth and resilience.
Leadership and Communication, Business Management, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency
Gain insights into the fundamental principles of Radio Frequency (RF) and microwave engineering in alignment with Singapore's Smart Industry Readiness Index.
Learn essential personal branding skills, overcome career stagnation and create impactful content for career advancement.
An executive programme that trains leaders in open source technology, risk management, and innovation, preparing them for Chief Open Source Officer roles.
Business Management, Leadership and Communication, Internet of Things, Executive Education
Certified Practitioner for Lifelong Learning and Competency Development
Master coaching techniques to foster 21st-century skills, resilience, and well-being, while developing effective strategies for personal and professional growth.

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
